content.p: Based on the above description of calcium homeostasis with parathyroid hormone, try to answer these questions without referring to the feedback loop diagram. When you are done, click the "next" button to display the completed feedback loop.

question.body: What is the variable being controlled by the feedback loop?

response.feedback: Correct. Proper blood calcium level is important for many body functions.
Incorrect. The parathyroid gland is involved in responding to changes in this variable. The variable is an ion whose concentrations can change.
Incorrect. The parathyroid hormone is a chemical used to communicate with the effectors.
Incorrect. Urination is one way for the effector to get rid of any excess variable, but it is not the variable that is being monitored and regulated.

part.hint: What is being monitored and needs to be adjusted in this example?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Blood calcium is the variable being regulated.
Correct. In this case the cells of the parathyroid glands monitor calcium levels, just like the cells of the pancreas monitor blood glucose levels.
Incorrect. The parathyroid hormone is a chemical used to communicate with the effectors.
Incorrect. The kidneys play a role in conserving or excreting calcium but are not the receptor monitoring the level of blood calcium.

part.hint: What senses the change in blood calcium levels?
This relationship between the receptor and control center is similar to that in the pancreas for glucose.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Blood calcium is the variable the endocrine system is trying to regulate.
Correct. This endocrine gland acts as both the receptor and control center.
Incorrect. These hormones are released from the control center and carry messages to effectors.
Incorrect. Kidneys can excrete excess calcium from the body. It is not the control center.

part.hint: What compares current calcium level to set point to adjust calcium levels?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The blood calcium level is being monitored and altered, but the effector is what causes calcium levels to change.
Incorrect. This endocrine gland acts as the receptor and control center, but not the effector.
Incorrect. This hormone carries information from the control center to the effectors.
Correct. The kidneys respond to hormone levels in order to excrete more or less calcium into the urine.

part.hint: Effectors tend to have the most direct effects on the variables.
